channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Hamas’ cease-fire demands; Joey Chestnut banned from hot dog contest
item.description: Mediators try to bridge gaps after Hamas’ demands to Biden’s cease-fire plan. America’s eating champion Joey Chestnut is banned from a NYC hotdog contest after signing with a plant-based meat company.
item.content:encoded:
Mediators try to bridge gaps after Hamas’ demands to Biden’s cease-fire plan. America’s eating champion Joey Chestnut is banned from a NYC hotdog contest after signing with a plant-based meat company.

(Image credit: Chris McGrath)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: A jury says Chiquita should pay millions over paramilitary killings in Colombia
item.description: The jury awarded plaintiffs $38.3 million in damages saying that Chiquita was liable for killings perpetrated by the AUC–Autodefensas Unidas de Colombia (the United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia).
item.content:encoded:
The jury awarded plaintiffs $38.3 million in damages saying that Chiquita was liable for killings perpetrated by the AUC–Autodefensas Unidas de Colombia (the United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia).

(Image credit: Danilo Gomez)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: India defeats the U.S. in a match in the Cricket T20 World Cup
item.description: The loss to India means the U.S. has a critical match coming up on Friday against Ireland. It's the first time the tournament has been held in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: The loss to India means the U.S. has a critical match coming up on Friday against Ireland. It's the first time the tournament has been held in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: A business leader, who's a vocal supporter of Trump, explains what corporations want
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to businessman and talk radio show host John Catsimatidis, CEO of Red Apple Group, about support for presumptive GOP presidential nominee Donald Trump among business leaders.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to businessman and talk radio show host John Catsimatidis, CEO of Red Apple Group, about support for presumptive GOP presidential nominee Donald Trump among business leaders.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trouble for ecstasy? What MDMA’s FDA setback could mean for psychedelics
item.description: Psychedelics researchers and investors are still reeling from last week’s no vote for MDMA by a panel of advisers to the FDA.
item.content:encoded:
Psychedelics researchers and investors are still reeling from last week’s no vote for MDMA by a panel of advisers to the FDA.

(Image credit: MirageC/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: David Lynch says he thought his newest work was 'total BS' at first
item.description:
David Lynch doesn't do a lot of interviews. The Twin Peaks and Mulholland Drive creator usually just lets his work speak for itself. But he was excited to talk to Rachel about his new album coming out this summer, Cellophane Memories. And he also was game to dive into his love for transcendental meditation, a fateful childhood psychosomatic illness and a memorable encounter with a Buddha statue.

To listen sponsor-free, access bonus episodes and support the show, sign up for Wild Card+ at plus.npr.org/wildcard
item.content:encoded:
David Lynch doesn't do a lot of interviews. The Twin Peaks and Mulholland Drive creator usually just lets his work speak for itself. But he was excited to talk to Rachel about his new album coming out this summer, Cellophane Memories. And he also was game to dive into his love for transcendental meditation, a fateful childhood psychosomatic illness and a memorable encounter with a Buddha statue.

To listen sponsor-free, access bonus episodes and support the show, sign up for Wild Card+ at plus.npr.org/wildcard

(Image credit: Vittorio Zunino Celotto)

item.title: Trump to meet with GOP lawmakers to sketch a plan for a possible second term
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is set to meet with congressional Republicans to discuss policy plans for a possible second administration.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump is set to meet with congressional Republicans to discuss policy plans for a possible second administration.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Whistleblower tells ProPublica about Microsoft's cybersecurity lapses
item.description: A Whistleblower told ProPublica that Microsoft chose profit over security and left the U.S. government vulnerable to a Russian hack.
item.content:encoded: A Whistleblower told ProPublica that Microsoft chose profit over security and left the U.S. government vulnerable to a Russian hack.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Fans turned out when the 'Bull Durham' house went on the market for $1.6 million
item.description: When the house where the iconic '80s baseball movie "Bull Durham" was filmed went on the market, it attracted a lot more fans than buyers.
item.content:encoded: When the house where the iconic '80s baseball movie "Bull Durham" was filmed went on the market, it attracted a lot more fans than buyers.
item.dc:creator: Leoneda Inge

item.title: While women outnumber men on campus, their later earnings remain stuck
item.description: On college campuses, women are making inroads in male-dominated fields like engineering and business. But that is not eliminating the earnings gaps in leadership and income in the workplace.
item.content:encoded:
On college campuses, women are making inroads in male-dominated fields like engineering and business. But that is not eliminating the earnings gaps in leadership and income in the workplace.

(Image credit: Ania Siniuk for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jon Marcus
